titleStmt.title: J. H. Wilkinson to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2125

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Cadiz, Trigg Co. Ky
June 12th 1865
To His Excellency
Gov. Bramlette:

The office of Magistrate in District No. 2. Trigg County, has become vacant by the death of Lemuel Byrom Esqr, and it is very important that the vacancy shall be immediately filled by the appointment of a suitable and competent person; I would recommend Mr. H. W. Smith of said District, who is every way worthy and ^well^ qualified for the position, and I believe his appointment will give general satisfaction to the people.

Very truly
your obt. Servant
J. H. Wilkinson

Dear Sir H. W. Smith who is recomended for the appointment of magistrate in the 2nd district in which I reside) by Judge J. H. Wilkinson who is the presiding Judge of the Trigg Co. Court. is in my opinion will qualified for said office & I write with the Judge in recommending his
appointment to said office

Justice Peace
Trigg Co
H. W. Smith
apptd
27 June/65
